intro: Spergula echinosperma, commonly known as the hairy sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Spergula echinosperma is typically found in moist, temperate habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its botanical features make it an important component of ecological systems supporting diverse wildlife.
